title: The Basics of Organic Growing Strawberries (in the Tropics)

subtasks: Confirming suitable varieties for hot tropical weather
Managing water and fertilizer until flowering
Preparing potting soil with cocopeat, garden soil, and vermicompost
Identifying the growing tip of the strawberry plant
Creating a depression in the potting soil to plant the strawberry
Gently removing the strawberry plant from its container
Ensuring the plant is planted without burying the growing tip
Firming the soil around the planted strawberry
Positioning two strawberry plants in each 12-inch diameter pot
Applying leaf mulch to retain moisture and protect strawberry fruit
Timing planting (October) for early January harvest
